data.text: Be not jealous over the wife of thy bosom,
Give not thy soul unto a woman
Use not much the company of a woman that is a singer,
Give not thy soul unto harlots,
Look not round about thee in the streets of the city,
Turn away thine eye from a beautiful woman,
Sit not at all with another manâ€™s wife,
Envy not the glory of a sinner:
Delight not in the thing that the ungodly have pleasure in;
Keep thee far from the man that hath power to kill:
As near as thou canst, guess at thy neighbor,
Let thy talk be with the wise,
And let just men eat and drink with thee;
For the hand of the artificer the work shall be commended;
A man of an ill tongue is dangerous in his city;
